org.cougaar.core.service
Interface PlaybookConstrainService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface PlaybookConstrainService
extends Service

This service allows components to modify AdaptivityEngine plays and playbooks.

This part of the service is used to alter the plays in the playbook by adding, modifying, or removing OperatingMode Policies. 

 
   Play - if THREATCON > 3 && ENCLAVE == THEATER
          then ENCRYPT = {56, 128}  - the first value is preferred

   Policy - if THREATCON > 3 && CPU > 90
            then ENCRYPT >= 128

 Plays formed by calling constrain(Policy)

        if (THREATCON > 3 && ENCLAVE == THEATER) 
           && (THREATCON >3 && CPU > 90)
        then ENCRYPT = {128}

        if (THREATCON > 3 && ENCLAVE == THEATER) 
           && !(THREATCON >3 && CPU > 90)
        then ENCRYPT = {56, 128}
This play can constrain this policy because their "then" clauses are operating on the same knobs.

Two plays result from constraining the original play with the policy. The "if" clause of the first new play has the "if" clause of the policy tacked on to it, and the knob on the "then" clause must be set to 128. The "if" clause on the second new play has the -negated- "if" clause of the policy tacked on. The "then" clause is untouched.

Method Summary
 void constrain(OperatingModePolicy omp)
          might replace one play with two in current playbook
 void unconstrain(OperatingModePolicy omp)
          might replace two plays with one in current playbook
 

Method Detail

constrain

void constrain(OperatingModePolicy omp)
might replace one play with two in current playbook

Parameters:
omp - OperatingModePolicy may constrain the play

unconstrain

void unconstrain(OperatingModePolicy omp)
might replace two plays with one in current playbook

Parameters:
omp - OperatingModePolicy
